RECORD.TEXT: 335422736 Unsigned Admission Date : Unsigned Discharge Date : 07/31/1997 DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : ASCENDING AORTIC DISSECTION PROCEDURE PERFORMED : Ms. List is a 67 year-old diabetic woman with a known thoracic aortic dissection . On December 29 , 1996 , the patient developed abdominal and back pain and presented to Drain Hospital . A dissected descending thoracic aorta was diagnosed by transesophageal echocardiogram . The patient was transferred to En's Healthcare for work-up . She was intubated with pulmonary edema and followed by serial examinations . January 2 CT scan of the chest showed a type III descending thoracic aortic aneurysm beginning distal to the left subclavian artery and ending above the renal artery . January 4 , a CT scan of the chest demonstrated bilateral pleural effusions , parenchymal consolidation right greater than left , aortic dissection with true and false lumens , well delineated flap with compression of the true lumen secondary to mass effect of thrombus in the false lumen . There was a mediastinal hematoma . January 23 , 1996 , the patient had a CT scan , again showing ascending aorta with low density abnormality , with findings suspicious for involvement of the ascending aorta by dissection , bilateral pleural effusions were improved . The patient reports having been hospitalized for approximately one month , at which time she was discharged to a nursing home after refusing surgery . The patient has had dyspnea on exertion since January , 1996 , increasing in the last month , and increasing abdominal distention . The patient denies history of myocardial infarction or chest pain . She does have shortness of breath and pedal edema . She has had atrial fibrillation for five years . No paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea . She does orthopnea of three to four pillows . The patient underwent CT scan on Jul 24 , 1997 , which demonstrated dissection of the ascending and archaorta to the root . CT scan also demonstrated stable descending thoracic dissection with resolution of luminal compression . Congestive heart failure . Atrial fibrillation . Hypertension . Hiatal hernia . History of gastrointestinal bleed on aspirin . Status post appendectomy . Status post umbilical hernia repair . Status postventral hernia repair . SOCIAL HISTORY : History of 40 pack years smoking , quit in December , 1996 . Occasional ethanol . ALLERGIES : Sulfa , which gives her a rash . MEDICATIONS : She is in no acute distress . She is afebrile with irregular heart rate at 96 . Blood pressure is 138/72 . She is on room air at 90% . Oropharynx showed poor dentition with apparent decay of the remaining teeth and gum recession . The lungs demonstrated wheezes on auscultation with crackles at the bases . Cardiovascular was irregularly irregular rhythm and rate . Holosystolic murmur , II / VI , at the left lower sternal border . The abdomen was obese , protuberant , nontender with well-healed surgical scars . Extremities showed no clubbing or cyanosis . Varicosities particularly left lower extremity front and back and right upper extremity medially . There were 2+ pedal pulses bilaterally , 2+ radial pulses bilaterally . LABORATORY DATA : Significant for white blood cell count of 6.8. BUN 14 , creatinine 1 . Urinalysis was negative . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted for preoperative work-up prior to planned repair of her ascending aortic dissection . The patient was evaluated by the Dental Service , who felt that it was necessary to extract several teeth and to follow several more , specifically tooth 15 and 16 , that were fully impacted . The patient received periprocedure antibiotics . The patient underwent echocardiogram on Jul 25 , 1997 , demonstrating 2/4+ tricuspid regurgitation with a peak velocity of 2.9 ; mitral regurgitation 2/4 , mild concentric hypertrophy of the left ventricle ; no systolic function with mild septal hypokinesis . The ejection fraction was estimated at 55% . The aortic valve appeared sclerotic with mild to moderate insufficiency . Dissection flap was noted . There was pulmonary artery systolic pressure estimated at 34 mmHg plus right atrial pressure . There was also evidence of a secundum type atrioseptal defect , approximately 0.5 centimeters in size , with elevated right atrial pressure . The patient also underwent cardiac catheterization on Jul 25 , 1997 , demonstrating elevated right heart filling pressures with a mean right atrial pressure of 19 , right ventricular pressure of 56/19 , pulmonary artery pressure of 56/23/39 , pulmonary capillary wedge pressure was 24/26/21 . Non selective coronary arteriography performed did not reveal the presence of any focal coronary artery disease . The aortic root angiography revealed the presence of an extensive ascending aortic dissection . True lumen could not be accessed from either the left or right femoral artery . The true lumen required access by right radial artery and tortuous innominate artery . The patient was taken to the Operating Room on Jul 26 , 1997 , where she underwent resection and repair of chronic aortic dissection and reconstruction of the super coronary tube graft Hemashield # 28 as well as primary repair of an atrioseptal defect which appeared consistent with a patent foramen ovale and was 1-2 centimeters insize . On postoperative day number one , however , the patient was hemodynamically stable on a small amount of heparin and nitroglycerin with a cardiac index of 3 . The patient required diuresis in her course after receiving multiple blood products . Beta blocker was started as well . The patient was transferred to the floor on postoperative day number three . She did demonstrate evidence of a right brachial neuropathy , likely associated with the extensive dissection required for access to the right axillary artery , given the patient 's distorted anatomy due to the large dissection . The patient was evaluated by Physical Therapy and Occupational Therapy and received therapy to the right upper extremity and hand . She will require continued therapy . Otherwise the patient was neurologically intact . The determination was made not to Coumadinize the patient given herchronic descending thoracic dissection and history of gastrointestinal bleeding . The patient has been chronically in atrial fibrillation preoperatively without Coumadin therapy . The patient did require extensive pulmonary toilet and she continues to benefit from nebulizer therapy , chest physiotherapy and diuresis . Her chest x-ray prior to discharge demonstrated bilateral small effusions , right greater than left . On 2 liters nasal cannulaoxygen , she is saturating at 93-95% . The patient will be transferred to rehabilitation for reconditioning in general and specifically in regard to her right upper extremity .
